sentence: Vice Chair Liz Cheney, a Wyoming Republican, told ABC News of "firsthand testimony" that Trump's daughter Ivanka, then a West Wing adviser, twice asked him to intervene in a melee in which police officers were beaten by his crowd.
author: Stephen Collinson
title: January 6 committee gets inside Trump's West Wing wall of obstruction

title: Abbreviated Pundit Roundup: January 6 anniversary edges closer

sentence: They may be on opposite poles among House Republicans in their attitudes toward former President Donald Trump, but Rep. Liz Cheney got an unexpected compliment from firebrand freshman Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene on her conservative voting record.
author: Emily Brooks
title: Marjorie Taylor Greene: Liz Cheney has more conservative' voting record than some in GOP

sentence: They want an actual representative, and Liz Cheney spends 100 percent of the time talking about Jan. 6.? The select committee denies its work is intended to harm Trump politically, with a panel spokesperson saying it is undertaking a nonpartisan, apolitical investigation aimed at uncovering facts and getting answers about a violent attack on American democracy.? Cheney's campaign is also highlighting legislation she introduced in 2021, including bills to curb the federal government's ability to place a moratorium on oil and gas leasing and repay states for any lost revenue resulting from such freezes.
author: Tal Axelrod
title: Jan. 6 probe roils Cheney race in Wyoming

sentence: Billionaire Peter Thiel hosted about two dozen Republican donors at his 10,000-square-foot Miami compound on Wednesday night to raise money for Wyoming Republican Harriet Hageman, the Donald Trumpbacked candidate running a primary challenge against GOP representative Liz Cheney.
author: Gabriel Sherman
title: It Was All About How the 2020 Election Was Stolen: Billionaire Peter Thiel Hosts Fundraiser for Liz Cheney Challenger

sentence: Susan Collins of Maine, who did vote to convict Trump in his second impeachment trial, said in response to Trump's pardon comments: We should let the judicial process proceed.? She also called January 6 a dark day in our history.? Rep. Liz Cheney, the top Republican on the House select committee investigating the Capitol attack (and one of ten out of 211 Republicans in the House who voted to impeach Trump), also spelled out the dangerous implications of Trump's recent statements on Twitter: Whether pardons for convicted rioters willlike Republicans' watering down the seriousness of January 6become something of an adopted party line remains to be seen, the Washington Post's Philip Bump pointed out.
title: At Least Some Republicans Realize It's Batshit for Trump To Dangle Pardons for Capitol Rioters

sentence: Most notable is Trump's nemesis Rep. Liz Cheney (R-Wyo.)

sentence: A potential criminal prosecution, however, could represent a significant return for the two GOP members of the panel, Reps. Liz Cheney of Wyoming and Adam Kinzinger of Illinois, who have put their political careers on the line to oppose Trump.

title: January 6 committee's aggressive approach on Trump may put Merrick Garland in a tight spot

sentence: Fox's Sean Hannity and Meadows had been texting since Election Day Earlier this year Rep. Liz Cheney read text messages between Meadows and several Fox News hosts during the Jan. 6 Capitol riot, including Sean Hannity.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene said some lawmakers talked martial law after Jan. 6, according to texts released by CNN
